A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved self-efficacy (confidence) related to falls and/or reduced fear of falling (e.g., confidence in one's ability to get up after a fall); -Improved self-efficacy (confidence) related to falls-related physical health; -Improved self-efficacy (confidence) related to behaviors to prevent falls and/or readiness to make changes (e.g., belief in one's ability to manage the risk of falls).

PON2: Increase Behavior Changes to Prevent Falls
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved routines; -Increased preventative physical activity; -Increased preventative healthcare utilization; -Installation of new home or environmental adaptations; -Increased recommended use of appropriate assistive devices, adaptive devices, and/or home modifications.

PON2: Improve Independent Functioning Related to Falls Prevention
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved general functioning (e.g., independent living, quality of life, self-care); -Improved cognitive health (e.g., processing speed, cognitive reaction time); -Improved social health (e.g., satisfaction in social relationships).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved balance; -Improved strength; -Improved flexibility; -Improved walking patterns, gait, and/or stride; -Improved mobility; -Improved general health indicators (e.g., pain, blood pressure, sleep).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Reduced or no occurrences of falls; -Reduced number of recurring falls; -Reduced injuries and/or medical care resulting from falls.

PON2: Increase Utilization of Mental and Behavioral Health Services
PON Definition: A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Mental and behavioral health services, including therapy, counseling, psychiatry, etc.; -Mental and behavioral health crisis services, including helplines, psychiatric emergency departments, hospitalization, etc.; -Mental and behavioral health services consistently (e.g., retention).

PON2: Improve Mental and Behavioral Health Knowledge and Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased knowledge about mental and behavioral health; -Improved skills to support mental and behavioral health (stress management, coping, substance refusal skills, mindfulness, etc.).

PON2: Increase Positive Attitudes Toward Mental Health and Recovery
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved attitudes and motivations about seeking support for mental and behavioral health (help seeking attitudes, reduced fear, intention to use services, treatment readiness, etc.); -Improved attitudes and motivations to support behavior change; -Reduced stigma towards mental and behavioral health disorders, including internalized stigma.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved attitudes and beliefs about oneself, including one's capabilities (self-esteem, self-efficacy, sense of purpose, etc.); -Improved attitudes and beliefs about one's circumstances (life satisfaction, resilience, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Reduced unhealthy substance use or misuse (alcohol, drugs, tobacco, etc.); -No occurrences of unhealthy substance use or misuse (alcohol, drugs, tobacco, etc.); -Reduced problems related to unhealthy substance use or misuse (symptoms, urges, consequences, quality of life, etc.).

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved symptoms of a diagnosed or undiagnosed clinical mental health disorder; -Improved cognitive health; -Improved behavioral health; -Improved emotional health;  -Improved social health; -Improved general functioning (independence, quality of life, role functioning, sleep, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Provision of safe and effective healthcare; -Provision of healthcare that fosters respectful treatment, open communication between patients and physicians, alignment between patient preferences and treatments received, and higher levels of patient satisfaction; -Provision of time-and cost-efficient healthcare.

PON2: Increase Health Self-Efficacy and Engagement in Care Decisions
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Positive attitudes towards seeking health services (the benefits of screenings, feeling comfortable seeking medical care, etc.); -Improved health-related self-efficacy, including patient activation and caregiver self-efficacy; -Improved health-related decision-making power, including active participation in treatment.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Use of medications or medical devices as discussed with a health care provider; -The monitoring or tracking a health condition in accordance with medical guidance; -Positive health behaviors to care for an existing health condition.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved ability to read and understand health-related information -Increased disease prevention and health promotion knowledge  -Increased disease treatment and management knowledge

A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Short-term or acute health care (short-term hospitalizations, cavity filling, cast for a broken bone, etc.); -Long-term or continuous health care (dialysis, cancer treatments, palliative physician home visits, etc.); -Hospice care (pain relief, bereavement services, etc.).

A beneficiary has accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Preventative healthcare and health promotion services (physicals, mammograms, immunizations, high blood pressure screening, etc.); -Preventative dental care (e.g., regular dental screenings / cleanings / routine x-rays); -Preventative vision care (e.g., regular eye screenings / exams).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year:  -Increased sales, revenue, profits, or production; -Expansion of client base or access to new markets; -Increased number of employees.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved internal business solutions (e.g., automation of operational processes, adoption of new technology, etc.); -Improved ability to adjust operations to meet market demands (e.g., development of new or improved services or products, improved marketing, etc.); -Improved ability to withstand unforeseen shocks and external economic events (e.g., financial plan to enable future organizational functioning and growth, sufficient savings, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year:  -Creation of a business; -Formalization of a business (e.g., registration of business, meeting accreditation, etc.).

A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -An affordable business loan; -Additional non-loan capital to support business operations (private investments, grants/awards, pro bono services, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Knowledge of business terms and concepts (operations, marketing, innovation, etc.); -Skills to start and run a business (developing a business concept, recognizing opportunities/risks, marketing skills, etc.); Completion of entrepreneurial coursework or industry-recognized certifications, training or other credentials.

PON2: Increase Personal Financial Empowerment and Decision-Making Autonomy
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved confidence to manage personal finances, making sound financial decisions, engaging in financial practices, or sticking to a financial plan; -Financial autonomy or decision-making power (e.g., joint household decision-making, operating financial accounts independently, having control over use of income).

PON2: Increase Access to Personal Finance Services
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -A non-dormant savings and/or checking account or other transaction accounts (e.g., reloadable debit card, remittance account); -An affordable, non-predatory credit or loan, including formal loans and micro-credit; -A lending and/or savings group -Resources such as individual retirement savings accounts, pension plan, employer-based retirement account -a formal financial service (e.g., tax preparation, credit counseling).

PON2: Increase Personal Finance Literary and Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Knowledge of the core concepts of personal finance needed to effectively spend, save, plan, and borrow (e.g., understanding loan terms, fees, credit, and interest rates; managing a savings account); -Skills to perform tasks that support responsible spending, saving, planning, managing debt, and borrowing (e.g., ability to set financial goals, monitor account balances regularly, etc.); -Awareness of financial institutions and products, financial assistance, and resources (e.g., planning for retirement, public assistance, unemployment insurance).

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Contributions to and maintenance of liquid savings (e.g., savings without specified purpose); -Timely payments for bills, credit cards, and/or loans (e.g., avoided late payments); -Meaningful gains in credit score; -The ability to cover day-to-day expenses, including having enough money for necessities, being able to make regular housing payments, being able to afford household goods, and having the ability to provide for others.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results in the past year: -Enrollment in or maintenance of an affordable insurance policy for self or key assets (e.g., house or condo insurance, renter's insurance, health insurance); -Enough resources to withstand a negative income shock (e.g., job loss) or expense shock, including emergency savings and buffer savings.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased long-term savings, investments, and/or assets (e.g., retirement savings, education savings, land ownership); -Reduction of debt, including loans, credit cards, and debt to others; -Spent less than income over the last year; -Enrollment in or maintenance of a life insurance policy.

PON2: Improve Responsible Decision-Making Skills for Youth
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Fewer or no incidents of school misbehavior (discipline referral, suspension etc.); -Fewer or no incidents of general high-risk behaviors that can result in accidental death (motor vehicle accidents, drowning, fires, etc.); -Improved ability to make reasoned judgements after analyzing information, thinking before acting, identifying solutions for personal and social problems, and/or anticipating and evaluating the consequences of one's actions; -Access to mental health and/or cognitive behavioral therapy services.

PON2: Increase Knowledge of Civics and Social Responsibility for Youth
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased knowledge and understanding of civics and social issues (public rights, inequities, political issues, environmental issues, etc.); -Increased awareness of one's civic/social responsibility; -Increased commitment to propagating social change.

PON2: Improve Positive Identity Development for Youth
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved view of and feelings about oneself (self-worth, self-esteem, self-confidence, and social/physical/community self-efficacy, etc.); -Improved personal identity development (self-concept, defining personal interests, understanding of internal priorities, etc.); -Improved social identity development (recognition and critical understanding of one's social identities pertaining to race, gender, social class, religion, culture, etc.); -Improved sense of agency (autonomy, independence, etc.); -Access to mental health and/or cognitive behavioral therapy services; -Access to and membership in pro-social activities (e.g. team sports, etc.).

PON2: Improve Social and Emotional Skills for Youth
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved emotional self-regulation skills (identification of emotions, coping skills, stress management, behavioral control, motivation, perseverance, ability to follow instructions/rules, etc.); -Improved social and relationship skills (communication skills, perspective-taking skills, empathy, conflict resolution skills, help seeking, cultural competence, etc.); -Improved day-to-day self-management skills (personal goal setting and attainment, self-discipline, etc.); -Improved leadership skills (guiding or directing others on a course of action, team-building skills, ability to teach/mentor others, etc.).

PON2: Develop or Convert New Affordable Housing
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -New or rehabbed safe, quality housing (rented or owned) that meets personal needs and is free or affordable. Safe housing includes being asbestos free, lead free, and structurally sound. Free or affordable includes subsidized housing, other forms of rent assistance, and/or a monthly expense that is no more than 30% of the household's income

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Retention of safe, high-quality housing (rented or owned) for at least three months that meets personal needs and is free or affordable. Safe housing includes being asbestos free, lead free, and structurally sound.

A beneficiary has gained access to one or more of the following results within the past year: -Safe, quality housing (rented or owned) that meets personal needs and is free or affordable; -Safe housing includes being asbestos free, lead free, and structurally sound; -Free or affordable includes subsidized housing, other forms of rent assistance, and/or a monthly expense that is no more than 30% of the household's income.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Immediate or emergency (i.e., non-natural disaster crisis) shelter -Transitional housing (e.g., group homes, short-term rentals)

PON2: Improve General Employability and Soft Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Gains in knowledge necessary to identify, search, and apply for jobs suited to their interests and strengths; -Competency in soft skills necessary for employability and job retention (e.g., communication skills, teamwork, problem solving); -Capability to complete basic work-related tasks (e.g., preparing job related documents, using a computer/internet to perform routine job functions); - Increased employment advancement opportunities; -Wage gains commensurate with skills attainment.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved benefits (e.g., paid sick and vacation days, medical insurance and retirement benefits); -Better working environment (e.g., manageable working hours, regular scheduling, safe and healthy work environments, increased accommodations); -Better job security (e.g., yearlong contract, protection against dismissal).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Achievement of job/career-related credentials or meaningful certifications (i.e., industry-recognized or in-demand certificates); -Improved knowledge, skills, and competencies for a specific job or career; -Completion of paid/unpaid internships, apprenticeships, volunteer opportunities, or fellowship positions that are aligned with career goals and interests.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Full-time, non-seasonal employment and retained it, typically for at least a quarter (i.e., 90 days); -Non-full-time employment (e.g., a part-time job, contract work; not including internships) and retained it, typically for at least a month (i.e., 30 days); -Improvement in the number of jobs and employment rate.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Meaningful increase in pay (such as a raise, cost-of-living increase, or bonus); -Promotion at their current place of work; -Additional job duties or responsibilities with concurrent wage increase.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased knowledge of available food assistance supports (e.g., knowledge of community-based or federal food resources/programs) that enable the purchase of nutritional foods -Increased understanding of nutritional needs; -Increased knowledge of how to prepare nutritious food at home.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved level of food security, or reduced level of food insecurity, as measured on a comprehensive survey of the ability to, at all times, afford and access enough food for an active and healthy life (e.g., the US Adult/Household Food Security Survey).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -An increased rate of volunteering in community/extracurricular organization(s); -Greater engagement in community life (e.g., joining a neighborhood association, etc.); -Mobilizing as part of a group to take action towards solving a civil issue.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased knowledge of how to navigate an entity or system (e.g., banks, higher education, healthcare), to meet their desired end goal (e.g., receive a resource, avoidance of harm, etc.), facilitated by relationships with knowledgeable individuals; -Increased self-efficacy or confidence in one's ability to navigate an entity or system (e.g., banks, higher education, healthcare) to meet a desired end goal (e.g., receive a resource, etc. avoidance of harm), facilitated by relationships with knowledgeable individuals.

PON2: Expand Use of Personal and Professional Networks
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Leaned on close high-quality relationships within a group or community to obtain needed help or resources; -Leaned on relationships with others who are different in some capacity to obtain needed help or resources the beneficiary would otherwise not have access to; -Leaned on direct, trusted connections who have significantly more access to power (societal or political) to obtain resources or assistance.

PON2: Increase Access to Personal and Professional Relationships
PON Definition: A beneficiary had increased access to one or more of the following results within the past year: -High-quality relationships within a group or community who would provide emotional or material help/support; -Relationships with others who are different in some capacity, characterized by trust that the other will provide help when it's needed; -Direct, trusted connections to individuals, groups or institutions who have significantly more access to power, characterized by those with authority who would provide access to resources or their influence.

PON2: Improve Positive STEM Identity and Self-Efficacy
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Confidence in their ability to master STEM topics; -Confidence in their ability to pursue a future STEM pathway (e.g., additional education, STEM careers, etc.); -Perceived support from family/community/school in pursuing a STEM pathway.

PON2: Increase Individual Issue Awareness and Advocacy
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Self-awareness of their role and impact regarding a certain issue; -A change in beliefs, attitudes, or values to align with a policy position; -Knowledge of appropriate approaches to address certain social issues (e.g., when to intervene in a conflict, etc.).

A beneficiary gained access to one or more of the following results within the past year: -A meal that is on-demand/request, affordable or free, and convenient (e.g., within 3 miles/25 min from home or work).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -The use of effective vector control methods to decrease the risk of disease (e.g., insecticide-treated nets for every 2 people living in the household and/or indoor residual spraying for Malaria).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased proficiency on literacy assessments; -Capability to complete tasks requiring the ability to read and write (e.g., receiving a high school equivalency degree, attaining citizenship goals, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Implementation and enforcement of policies that protect against discriminatory criminal behavior; -Implementation and enforcement of policies that protect against discriminatory policies or practices in public services or criminal justice; -Implementation and enforcement of policies that protect against discriminatory societal exclusion.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Implementation and enforcement of policies that protect against discriminatory voting policies or practices (e.g., voter ID laws, cuts to early voting, purges of voter rolls, voter intimidation, etc.); -Citizens have the ability to exercise political rights through political representation, voting, protection of the right to peaceful political assembly or protest, etc.

PON2: Increase Personal Independence of Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Maintenance of optimal capacity for self-care, adapted to living situation, assistive devices that allow for independent living; -Increased awareness of own condition and associated risks (comorbid conditions, diseases) and exhibited adherence to guidelines of care.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased supply of nutritional foods (e.g., inventory contains a higher number of pounds of nutritional foods available to customers); -Increased variety of nutritional foods available (e.g., inventory contains a higher number of produce options) -Increased visibility or promotion of nutritional foods (e.g., places nutritional foods in premium locations); -Increased affordability of nutritional foods (e.g., including acceptance of food vouchers) -Increased availability of culturally relevant foods

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Expanded number of individuals they served that received a meal that was affordable and convenient (e.g., within 3 miles/25 minutes of home or work); -Expanded proportion of individuals they served accessing at least one month of affordable and convenient food (e.g., within 3 miles/25 minutes of home or work); -Increased quantity of food available for distribution to food insecure individuals -Improved program efficiency (e.g., more efficient use of resources).
A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -A safe and secure supply of water that is maintained and monitored to ensure sustained access.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Maintained the genetic diversity of seeds and cultivated plants, as well as farmed and domesticated animals and their related wild species; -Maintained the soil, water, and air health, including reducing pollution of arable lands; -Implementation of sustainable practices for water, land, and livestock use.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Implemented sustainable agriculture practices; -Increased access to institutional and wholesale buyers; -Increased consumer awareness of sustainable agriculture through product labeling; -Creation of and access to reliable markets for sustainable agriculture products, including partnerships that link producers and buyers.

PON2: Improve Well-Being, Independence, and Financial Empowerment for Survivors of Domestic Violence
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -A personal plan to improve safety (including awareness of hotline services, crisis planning, locating a safe shelter/place of refuge, protecting finances, etc.); -Barrier reduction and access to services and supports to improve emotional wellbeing; -Improved skills in budgeting, saving, credit-building, and debt-management to improve financial stability and independence; -Improved legal, residential, and/or employment stability

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Investment in the development of advanced creativity skills (e.g., performing arts, creative thinking, visual arts, etc.); -Completion of artistic projects (e.g., paintings, videos, theater performances, etc.); -Investment in artistic community building initiatives to facilitate mentorship and collaboration.

PON2: Improve Support for Communities of Artists
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Artistic participation in the community that spurs economic growth in creative industries; -Establishment of art projects that attract new employees that contribute to the development of a new workforce (i.e., the creative class).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -GPA of 2.5 or higher in a STEM-related course; -Score(s) at/above math or science grade-level on standardized assessment (e.g., NAEP, state tests, etc.); -Met a qualifying requirement for an advanced STEM course/activity; -Enrollment in advanced STEM course/activity.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Declared a STEM-related major in college and/or graduate study; -Pursual/entry into STEM-related career, defined as a job/career that requires some advanced training in STEM (i.e., non-core secondary curriculum, education, and/or experience in science, technology, engineering and/or math); -Pursual/completion of a STEM-related degree (postsecondary or graduate).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increase interest in science, technology, engineering, and/or math on a generally accepted survey measure (i.e., S-STEM, STEM-CIS, etc.); -Taken additional steps to pursue their interest in STEM (e.g., additional class, follow-on program, club, etc.).

PON2: Improve Social Skills for Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Competent social skills (e.g., cooperation, social problem solving, etc.); -Increased self-worth (e.g., self-esteem, confidence, etc.).

PON2: Increase Early Childhood Social and Emotional Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary, before entering kindergarten, demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved sense of self and others; -Improved social competence; -Improved emotional competence; -Reduced behavior problems.

PON2: Increase Safe and Healthy Reproductive Choices
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Sufficient knowledge of human biology, sexual health, personal responsibility, and the importance of consent in order to make informed choices; -Access to resources that support family planning, including contraceptives, counseling on sexual health, and other lawful medical services; -Reduced incidence of sexual violence.

PON2: Increase K12 Attendance and Persistence in School
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved attendance rate (i.e., school or class attendance); -Matriculation from one grade to the next, from one year to the next; -Decrease in attendance gaps; -Decrease in year-to-year graduation gaps.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Sufficient knowledge of safe and healthy reproductive health practices; -Engages in and practices healthy reproductive behaviors, including contraceptive use, consensual sex, abstinence, etc..

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Placement in a permanent home through adoption or reunification; -Stayed in a permanent home that they were previously placed in through adoption or reunification.

PON2: Reduce Stigma Against Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Benefits from policies that eliminate the exclusion of individuals with disabilities from participation in private and public life; -Reduced stigma, prejudice and discrimination resulting from their disability.

PON2: Expand Systems for Reducing Risk of Disease
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment of standards and targets for the eradication of high-burden, global diseases (e.g., HIV/AIDs, malaria, tuberculosis, etc.) and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs); -Establishment and enforcement of policies that reduce the incidence, mortality, and/or prevalence rates of high-burden global diseases and neglected tropical diseases (NTDs).

PON2: Reduce Placement in Foster System Congregate Care
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Not been placed into a group home or institution (was served in family setting); -Alleviation of a mental, behavioral, or physical condition putting them at risk for being placed in a group home or institution.
A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -A normal BMI level (i.e., within height/weight ranges).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Cessation of or reduction in frequency/severity of subsequent arrests; -Reduced frequency or severity of subsequent criminal activity.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Decrease in overall crime rates; -Decrease in violent crimes rates; -Decrease in specific, targeted categories of criminal activity to improve public safety.

PON2: Reduce Recurrence of Child Abuse and Neglect
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Has not experienced any episodes of abuse or neglect at home or in foster home; -Reduced family risk factors (e.g., parent/caregiver depressive symptoms) and increase in protective family factors in parent-child relationships; -Reduced trauma-related symptoms; -A pattern of safe behavior to reduce subsequent violence.

A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Engagement in art projects in their community; -A range of different art projects in public spaces (e.g., free shows, special invitations to events, creative use of public spaces, etc.).

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment of legal protection to condemn inhumane treatment of animals (e.g., enactment of anti-cruelty laws); -Establishment and enforcement of policies that improve living conditions for animals.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Systems of social support to successfully transition from incarceration to the community; -Human capital (e.g., skills, knowledge, etc.) to maintain economic, residential, and social stability; -Removal of barriers preventing from achieving gainful employment, such as expunging eligible offenses from their records.

PON2: Improve Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Positive change in protective factors (e.g., parent-child relationships, social support); -Reduced risk factors (e.g., parent/caregiver depressive symptoms); -Improved physical and psychological safety.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment of a school environment that is safe, supportive, and academically challenging for students; -Increase level of community engagement and parent involvement; -Development of engaging instructional environments through evidence-based, engaging and rigorous curricula, textbooks and educational tools, improved class size and teacher-student ratios, improved physical school infrastructure, etc.; -Access to auxiliary services such as library, computer lab, nurse's offices, mental health, etc.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased awareness or understanding of political rights and responsibilities; -The active exercise of political rights (e.g., voting, peaceful political assembly or protest, engagement with politicians, etc.); -The ability to exercise political rights (e.g. through political representation, voting, protection of the right to peaceful political assembly or protest, etc.).

PON2: Improve Physical Well-Being of Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Healthy eating options and behaviors; -Avoidance of inappropriate weight loss or gain; -An age-appropriate level of physical fitness, functioning, safety, and mobility that prevent falls, injuries, hospitalizations, and reduce mortality.
A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -A pattern of daily, sustained physical activity; -Reduced sedentary activity.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improvement in economic indicators within the target area such as reduced unemployment or increased trade; -Establishment of non-violent initiatives (e.g., legislation, international agreements, etc.) to reach a sense of safety and security among external and internal groups.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Expanded number of participants receiving programming; -Expanded proportion of participants successfully utilizing or completing programming; -Dissemination of program best practices and research.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improvement and effective use of data collection and analysis resources and methods (e.g. database management, survey design and distribution, use of analytic software, staff/human capacity, etc.); -Creation or improvement of evaluation tools (e.g. logic model, theory of change, measurement plans, etc.); -Use of continuous quality improvement cycles, leveraging feedback of results into the program's evaluation strategy.

PON2: Improve or Maintain Quality of Programs
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Development of new or improved services, solutions, or products; -Implementation of evidence-based practices or "best practices" to achieve target outcomes; -Improved efficacy rate year over year, measured by the percentage of participants who are achieving target outcomes; -Maintained program quality standards.

PON2: Increase Early Childhood Language and Literacy Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary, before entering kindergarten, demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved oral language and communication skills; -Improved emergent literacy skills; -Improved early writing skills above and beyond expected developmental growth.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Sufficient capacity to prevent and treat diseases (i.e., organizational structures, highly trained workforces, and cross-agency partnerships); -Establishment of a leadership and governance structure to allocate public health resources; -Development of the capabilities for emergency risk management.

PON2: Improve Mental Well-Being of Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Has not been diagnosed with mental illness and has not experienced significant impairment of cognitive functioning; -Appropriate care for a mental condition; -Prevention or assistance in prevention of mental deterioration.

PON2: Increase Mental and Physical Well-Being Support for Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved mental symptoms, including decreased anxiety, depression, and distress; -Improved physical fitness, including increased strength, balance, and flexibility; -Improved quality of life through improved health.

PON2: Increase Early Childhood Math and Science Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary, before entering kindergarten, demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased knowledge of and ability to apply mathematical concepts; -Improved scientific process skills.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Necessary levels of preconception and prenatal health to birth a healthy child; -Low risks of pregnancy-related health complications or death; -Necessary levels of postpartum health and support to care for a child.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment and enforcement of polices that catalyze economic growth; -Growth on common indicators measuring economic growth (e.g., homeownership rates, median household income, etc.).

PON2: Increase Organizational Issue Awareness and Advocacy
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment of a system to reach targeted audiences, using a large number and variety of mediums (e.g., social media, word of mouth, newsletters, etc.); -Self-awareness among a majority of participants of their role and impact regarding a certain issue; -A change in social norms to align with a policy position (e.g., beliefs, attitudes, values, etc.).
A beneficiary accessed the following within the past year: -Internet that is affordable, usable, and well-connected (i.e., adequate speed).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Development of new insights in the field through scientific or empirical research; -Publication of research projects; -Knowledge management systems including systems for creating, retaining and transferring knowledge to enable innovation; -Application of research findings to develop new tools, frameworks, models, or practices that advance the field.

PON2: Increase Professional Development and Training of Individual Researchers
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Ability to receive funding for research and development; -Skills in creating, retaining, and transferring knowledge; -Collaboration and interaction with other researchers and professionals in the research community; -Increase in the number of grant funding, publications, and/or patents.

A beneficiary attained all of one or more of the following results within the past year: -A low risk of a premature or low-weight birth, of death from premature or low-weight birth, and of death from Sudden Unexpected Infant death (SUID); -Good health and optimal care before, during, and after pregnancy; -Survival through infancy to first birthday.

PON2: Increase Placement Stability for Children in Foster Care
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Placement in kinship care as opposed to non-relative caregiver care (if such option exists); -Placement with foster family where caregiver(s) has received adequate preparation, training, support, and therapy; -Placement with foster family and received training, support, and therapy; -Remained in the same placement setting.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improvement or growth in scores or level of proficiency on standards-based or norm-referenced assessments (e.g., tests, quizzes, rubrics, standardized tests, etc.); -Higher course grades or overall GPA; -New or increased enrollment in rigorous coursework (e.g., taking a new AP, IB, honors, DE, etc. course); -Decrease in achievement gaps; -Demonstrated year-to-year improvement in standard assessments.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved attitudes towards school and motivational beliefs (e.g. mastery orientation, academic identity, school-valuing, self-efficacy, perseverance, etc.); -Maintenance or improvement in attendance level; -Decrease in absenteeism.

PON2: Increase Identification and Referral of Domestic Violence Survivors
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Identification as a survivor of domestic violence by non-DV primary organizations (e.g., health clinics, first responders, child support organizations, law enforcement, etc.), and referrals to relevant support centers, health, educational, shelter, hotline, etc.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -High level of staff and volunteer satisfaction; -Performance rated at above expectation in their roles; -High level of organizational citizenship behavior such that staff and volunteers often complete tasks outside of their roles to achieve organizational goals; -Higher employee retention rate over time.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Transformational leadership practices including providing individualized direction and support, intellectual stimulation, reinforcement, visionary leadership, etc.; -High ratings of leadership effectiveness from staff, volunteers and stakeholders; -Fostering a culture of shared leadership by transferring transformational leadership practices to others, empowering leadership among subordinates, etc.

PON2: Improve Knowledge of Domestic Violence and Healthy Relationship Skills
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Awareness or knowledge of the impacts of violence in a relationship (e.g., types of abusive behavior, rape myths, patterns of perpetrator behavior, etc.) with the goal of risk reduction, and skills to develop respectful relationships (e.g., conflict resolution, communication).

PON2: Increase Healthy Food Consumption to Reduce Obesity
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Identification of proper nutrition needs; -A pattern of healthy eating behavior, including eating the recommended type and amount of food from the food groups.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased healthy eating behaviors (e.g., increased fruit and vegetable intake, less unhealthy foods consumed); -Adoption of healthy shopping or food purchasing habits (e.g., more nutrient-dense foods purchased) -Adoption of healthy food preparation habits (e.g., more nutrient-dense foods used in cooking).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Shared values, norms, and principles of the network; -Contribution to the network's goals and objectives -Improved collaboration and connectivity with other network organizations; -Host shared events with other network members; -Enhanced program/service coordination with other organizations to improve outcomes for beneficiaries.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Financial planning to enable future organizational functioning and growth; -Additional funding or resources for new research/program(s); -Sufficient funding or resources to cover all existing program and administrative costs.

PON2: Improve Financial Independence for Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Financial independence; -Sustained employment; -Material increase in their own wealth.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased income, revenue, or overall profitability achieved through better business planning, crop diversification, or creating value-added products; -Gained access to new or expanded market outlets or buyers; -Increased partnerships with local community organizations or businesses.

A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Exhibition and performance opportunities; -Participation or employment opportunities in creative industries (e.g., films, tv shows, concerts, theaters, etc.); -Residency opportunities with local institutions.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year:-Engagement with art projects that develop cultural, educational, heritage, and scientific value; -Increased appreciation of arts; -Increased knowledge of the different types of arts.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Support to institute a local, state, and/or federal policy (e.g., legislation, etc.) aligned to an organization's position; -Changes in practices/services to ensure policies achieve their intended goals; -Enforcing policies to ensure standards are upheld for intended audiences.

PON2: Improve End of Life Care for Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary with terminal condition attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -An appropriate level of support, attention, and palliative care; -Access to legal options for end-of-life care, if available.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Regained physical ability to transition to full-time, gainful employment, either through interventions to improve physical capabilities or adaptive supports; -Regained mental capacity and updated technical skills necessary to return to work; -Gained employment or volunteering opportunities.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Stockpile and provision of food supply that is proximate to residence, on-demand/request, and affordable or free in the event of a disaster; -Creation of a flexible supply chain and infrastructure for distribution; -Increase timeliness of food aid; -Increase network capacity and reach for distribution.

A beneficiary received one or more of the following results within the past year: -Rescue from a life-threatening situation; -Critical or immediate aid (e.g., food, clothing, shelter, etc.); -Necessary medical care; -Critical public infrastructure resources (e.g., electricity, water, etc.); -Alleviation of trauma-related psychological symptoms (e.g., post-traumatic stress).

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -A pattern of safe behavior to reduce physical, mental, or financial abuse; -Cessation of any subsequent episodes of abuse -Alleviation of related psychological symptoms (e.g., depression, anxiety, etc.); -Appropriate legal assistance to prevent or avoid existing abusive situation and/or received referrals to relevant behavioral, psychological, and/or educational services.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Use of best practice teaching methods for class preparation, classroom management, and instruction; -Investment in professional development (e.g., obtaining relevant new certifications or recertifications; attending classes, trainings, or professional teaching conferences); -Provision of auxiliary support services for students; -Provision of materials and technologies for fostering a high-quality learning environment.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Effective, certified school leaders with access to professional development opportunities; -Effective school management including effective planning and coordination, measurable goals for student achievement, high teacher retention, accountability measures, etc.; -A culture of learning including parent involvement, support from staff through shared leadership, a school-wide vision of success, etc.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Benefits from policies against discriminatory hiring, promotion, and/or firing practices; -Benefits from policies against discriminatory workplace policies and practices (e.g., harassment, discriminatory parenting policies, etc.); -Benefits from policies against discriminatory pay policies or practices (e.g., unequal pay for equal work, unlawfully withholding pay, etc.).

PON2: Increase Economic Participation for Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Benefits from policies against discriminatory hiring, promotion and/or firing practices; -Benefits from policies against discriminatory workplace policies and practices; -Benefits from policies against discriminatory pay policies or practices.

PON2: Improve Disaster Resilience and Risk Mitigation
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Establishment of a coordinated process across agencies to respond to natural disasters; -An adequate quantity of disaster response agencies given the needs of a local population (e.g., hospital providers, trauma centers, etc.); -Establishment and enforcement of policies to mitigate the risk of natural disasters; -All buildings within a geographic region are up to code in terms of safety regulations; -Establishment of a national or regional preparedness system to prevent, avoid, or stop any imminent threats towards a community.

A beneficiary accomplished one or more of the following results within the past year: -Rebuilt community infrastructure (e.g., roads, water supply, electrical grids), public facilities, and private housing; -Recovered businesses and means of livelihood for its members; -Provided health care to alleviate physical and psychological trauma-related consequences (e.g., physical disability, substance abuse, etc.).

A beneficiary, before entering kindergarten, demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved ability to focus their attention and to persist on tasks; -Improved ability to direct their own learning experiences; -Improved ability to use reasoning skills; -Improved executive functioning skills.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Knowledge of computer, internet, and other technological basics and applications; -Skillful use of computer, internet, and other technological applications to perform routine functions; -Specialized technological skills in area of interest or need (e.g., use of specialized technological products, use of more advanced computer applications, etc.); -Increase in employment and wages.

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Increased interest in traditional practices, history, and culture in an ethnic/religious group (e.g., holidays, ceremonies, etc.); -Increased engagement and interactions within an ethnic/religious community; -Preservation of traditional practices from the past for future generations in an ethnic/religious group (e.g., holidays, ceremonies, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Benefits from institutional policies (e.g., constitutional provisions, laws, etc.) against religious discrimination; -A desire to understand one's own and other's cultures; -Understanding towards ethnic/religious groups; -Increased cross-cultural competency; -Decrease in incidence of hate crime.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Enrollment in education geared towards an ethnic/religious group; -A full understanding of concepts, values, and traditions that strengthen their sense of identity.

PON2: Improve Communication and Transportation Resources for Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Resources for easier communication (translation, interpretive services, emergency response systems); -Transportation assistance.

A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Obtained a new patent for an innovation; -Sufficient capital to produce and scale an innovation; -Success in bringing the innovation to market or achievement of market disruption.

PON2: Increase Support for Caregivers of Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results in the past year: -Sufficient knowledge about providing care for a person with specific condition; -Increased awareness and/or behavioral patterns aimed at coping with caregiver burden; -Prevention of emotional distress, depression, and anxiety in caregivers.

A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Stable living conditions (i.e., adoption from a shelter to a safe home) and proper care (e.g., humane treatment, adequate nutrition, etc.) to support well-being.

PON2: Reduce Social Isolation of Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary attained one or more of the following results within the past year: -Appreciation of issues and challenges elderly people face and sensitivity towards their conditions; -Improved self-confidence as a senior -Increased social network as a senior through connection to the community, friendly visiting, attendance of group counselling, senior dating, social integration programs, etc.; -Reduced social isolation and loneliness as a senior.

A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results in the past year: -A latrine and personal hygiene training, products, and facilities; -Consistent use of proper hygiene practices, including hand-washing with soap, proper use of toilets, and proper disposal of waste.

PON2: Increase Support Services for Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Medical Resources; -Educational Resources; -Professional Resources; -Resources that support independent functioning in daily life.

PON2: Increase Access to Quality Legal Services
PON Definition: A beneficiary accessed one or more of the following results within the past year: -Affordable, effective legal counselling; -Financial, organizational, and cultural resources for legal services.

PON2: Obtain a Week's Worth of Food
PON Definition: A beneficiary gained access to one or more of the following results within the past year: -Sufficient food or meals for themselves and dependents for one week, that are consistently available, affordable or free, and conveniently located (e.g., within 3 miles/25 min of home/work).

PON2: Expand Legal Support for Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Free or affordable counseling on legal, and/or insurance questions whenever needed; -Free or affordable assistance in insurance enrollment, bill payment, and/or other financial/legal operations; -Increased awareness of money management and personal finances.

PON2: Expand Housing Supports for Older Adults
PON Definition: A beneficiary achieved one or more of the following results within the past year: -Affordable housing or temporary housing options; -A stable place to live through home ownership and has retained stable housing; -Targeted support from the community (e.g., rent assistance, housing voucher, public housing, etc.).

PON2: Improve Academic Achievement for Individuals with Disabilities
PON Definition: A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Development in adequate cognitive functioning (e.g., information processing, problem solving, etc.); -Higher scores, level of proficiency, or growth on standards-based or norm-referenced assessments (e.g., tests, quizzes, etc.).

A beneficiary demonstrated one or more of the following results within the past year: -Improved cognitive skills (e.g., critical thinking, working memory, creative thinking, etc.); -Improved organizational and study skills (e.g., time management, planning, task persistence, etc.); -Improved ability to work in teams and in collaboration with others; -Improved social-emotional self-regulation.
